item.title: Github Pages for your Website
item.description:
When creating your website, blog or a simple portfolio page you’ll eventually come to the point where you need to find a service / place to upload it. You can either choose a paid service or try one of the free options that are often not reliable, slow or include ads.

Or you try GitHub. You might have heard of Git or GitHub or even used it as version control system. Many companies use it in technical departments, wherever code is involved.

It also works great to host any type of static websites (More about static websites). This entire website is hosted on GitHub, here: cinereal.github.io

Github pages have the additional benefit of enforced SSL encryption (HTTPS).

In this article we go over setting up the simplest of websites to get familiar with the GitHub interface and learn how to use Git via command line to sync up your local repository to your GitHub page.
